DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type of therapies administer to the local area of the body.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information regarding the last administration of therapy to the local-regional (affecting only a restricted part or area of the body).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Local-Regional; affecting only a restricted part or area of the body.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Of or belonging to both a local and regional area of the body.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.:Given.

Concepts.definition: Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the type of therapies administer to the local area of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The hue of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between yellow and blue, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 490 to 570 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation and whose hue is that of the emerald or somewhat less yellow than that of growing grass.: Removal, separation, detachment, extirpation, or eradication of a body part, pathway, or function by light amplification by stimulated emission of radiation.

Concepts.definition: The hue of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between yellow and blue, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 490 to 570 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation and whose hue is that of the emerald or somewhat less yellow than that of growing grass.
Removal, separation, detachment, extirpation, or eradication of a body part, pathway, or function by light amplification by stimulated emission of radiation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into or near a tumor.

Concepts.definition: A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material is placed inside the body, into a tumor or body cavity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The hue of the long-wave end of the visible spectrum, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 630 to 750 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation and whose hue resembles that of blood: Removal, separation, detachment, extirpation, or eradication of a body part, pathway, or function by light amplification by stimulated emission of radiation.

Concepts.definition: The hue of the long-wave end of the visible spectrum, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 630 to 750 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation and whose hue resembles that of blood
Removal, separation, detachment, extirpation, or eradication of a body part, pathway, or function by light amplification by stimulated emission of radiation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The use of extreme cold to damage or destroy a body part, pathway, or function. The procedure is performed using small cryogenic probes during surgery, and has recently been applied to solitary sporadic renal tumor lesions.

Concepts.definition: The use of extreme cold to damage or destroy a body part, pathway, or function. The procedure is performed using small cryogenic probes during surgery, and has recently been applied to solitary sporadic renal tumor lesions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No value exists._Removal, separation, detachment, extirpation, or eradication of a body part, pathway, or function by light amplification by stimulated emission of radiation.

Concepts.definition: Removal, separation, detachment, extirpation, or eradication of a body part, pathway, or function by light amplification by stimulated emission of radiation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any therapeutic procedure that targets, or is restricted to, a specific anatomical location._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Concepts.definition: Any therapeutic procedure that targets, or is restricted to, a specific anatomical location.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

DataElement.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
